body_html: @jetW Does your graph contain any tf.while loops? If so, it may get stuck because of a bug in tfdbg in version 1.0.0 that causes the debugger to freeze on certain while loops. This bug has been fixed in master/HEAD. Maybe you can try our nightly builds, or wait for the next release for the fix.
body_text: @jetW Does your graph contain any tf.while loops? If so, it may get stuck because of a bug in tfdbg in version 1.0.0 that causes the debugger to freeze on certain while loops. This bug has been fixed in master/HEAD. Maybe you can try our nightly builds, or wait for the next release for the fix.
body: @jetW Does your graph contain any tf.while loops? If so, it may get stuck because of a bug in tfdbg in version 1.0.0 that causes the debugger to freeze on certain while loops. This bug has been fixed in master/HEAD. Maybe you can try our [nightly builds](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/#installation), or wait for the next release for the fix.
